summary: Design and guide development of a low-code, configuration-driven Task & Form Management application (Zoho Creator-style) with master data management, dynamic form definitions, reusable/versioned forms, task assignments/reassignments, journey tracking, and escalation/TAT/SLA tracking.
architectural_notes: Clarified task creation approach: Admin configures Task Definitions by selecting 1..N existing Form Definitions; tasks are created normally from the definition (not auto-created from form submission). Each attached form must support independent save/submission status within a task.
known_issues: Left sidebar menu is broken/needs fixing (reported by user).
Form Builder item/link is missing from the left sidebar navigation (user cannot find/access Form Builder from sidebar).
Form Builder fails to create a Form Definition (user reports form definition creation is failing during testing).
Form Builder is not saving/persisting Form Definitions (user reports form definition save is failing).

existing_features.title: Implement authentication and role-based access control so that only Admin users can create/edit master data, master lists, and form definitions; non-admin users can only work on tasks and submit assigned forms according to task visibility rules.

Create Master Data Management for fixed masters (Users, Roles, Departments, Statuses, Categories, Priorities) and user-defined master lists, including CRUD operations, lookup support, and Admin-only edit permissions.

Implement a dynamic Form Definition model with versioning and field definitions so Admin users can build reusable forms, including validation metadata and support for: Single Line, Multi Line, Number, Date, Date-Time, Dropdown, Multi-Select, and File Upload fields.

Enable custom form fields to reference master data via lookups, with dropdown and multi-select options loaded dynamically from masters at runtime, and ensure master changes automatically reflect in all dependent form renders.
Store custom forms as reusable entities that can be linked to multiple task definitions, and implement submission tracking per form version including a read-only view of prior submissions.

Implement Task Definitions and Task Instances that support attaching multiple custom forms and tracking per-form completion status, including task metadata: Task Type, Priority, Status, Owner, Created Date, Due Date, and Completion Date.

Implement assignment and reassignment workflows: tasks can be assigned to a department pool or a specific user; department-assigned tasks can be picked up by a department member; tasks can be reassigned to another department/user while enforcing visibility rules.
Provide task journey tracking (audit history) showing the lifecycle of a task across status changes, assignments, pickups, reassignments, and form submissions, viewable in the UI.

Implement escalation rules and TAT/SLA tracking for tasks, including calculating elapsed time vs due time, a task SLA status (On track / At risk / Breached), and recording escalation events when thresholds are exceeded.

Create a coherent, consistent UI theme for an enterprise admin/workflow tool (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and apply it across Admin (masters/forms/task definitions) and User (tasks/forms/journey) areas using Tailwind + existing UI components.

Fix the left sidebar menu so it renders and behaves correctly across the app, including: (1) menu sections and items are consistently visible and clickable, (2) clicking an item navigates to the correct route, (3) the active menu item is highlighted correctly for exact and nested routes, and (4) the sidebar collapse/expand trigger works without breaking layout.
Fix the Form Builder create flow so creating a new Form Definition does not fail due to an invalid/missing `creator` Principal being sent from the frontend.
Implement missing React Query fetch hooks for form definitions so the Form Builder can load and display existing form definitions using the backend APIs.

Fix the Form Builder create/save flow so that creating a new Form Definition from the UI successfully persists the definition in the backend and it appears in the Form Definitions list after save and after a full page reload.

Correct the Form Builder payload encoding to match the backend candid types for FormDefinition/FormField (including variant and optional field shapes) so backend calls to createFormDefinition and updateFormDefinition accept the data without traps.
Add an edit flow on the Form Builder page so an Admin can open an existing Form Definition from the list, modify it, and save changes using updateFormDefinition; ensure the list reflects updates.
Test the full Admin Form Builder workflow end-to-end (create, list, edit, delete) and fix any discovered issues that prevent completion of the workflow before publishing.
Wire up React Query hooks for task definitions, tasks, and task form submissions so they call real backend actor methods instead of returning placeholders.

Replace the placeholder Admin Task Definitions page with a working UI to list, create, and edit Task Definitions, including selecting one or more existing Form Definitions (multi-select) and enforcing the “at least one form” rule in the UI.
Replace the placeholder Create Task page with a working UI that allows creating a Task from a selected Task Definition and required task metadata, then navigates to the new Task’s detail page.
Implement the Task Detail “fill form” and “view submission” actions so users can open an attached form, submit it for the task, and then view the saved submission from the task’s forms panel.

new_feature_requests.summary: Master Data Management: Admin-managed master forms for users/roles/departments/statuses/categories/priorities and user-defined master lists, referencable via lookups across transactional forms.

Dynamic Form Builder: Form Definition model with versioning; Admin can define forms and field definitions (type, label, required, validations) supporting common field types (text, number, date/datetime, dropdown/multi-select, file upload).
Master Data in Custom Forms: Allow custom form fields to reference master forms via lookups; dropdowns/multi-selects load master values dynamically and reflect master updates automatically.
Reusable Custom Forms: Store custom forms as reusable entities that can be linked to multiple tasks; maintain version history and submission tracking.

Task Management with Multiple Forms: Task definitions support attaching multiple custom forms (subforms/related forms), track per-form completion, and include task metadata (type, priority, status, owner, created/due/completion dates).

Assignment/Reassignment Workflow: Create tasks from task definitions; assign to department/user with department task pool pickup; enable reassignment to another department/user with appropriate visibility controls.
Task Journey Tracking: Provide view of task journey/history across assignments and status changes.
Escalation & TAT/SLA: Implement task escalation rules with TAT/SLA tracking.
UI/Navigation: Close/disable side previews (hide the side preview panel in the UI).

Ensure the left sidebar renders a visible and clickable "Form Builder" navigation item under the "Administration" section for Admin users, and that clicking it navigates to the existing Form Builder route at "/admin/forms".

Ensure the left sidebar contains a visible and clickable “Form Builder” navigation item under the “Administration” section for Admin users, and that it navigates to the existing route “/admin/forms” and highlights as active when on that route.

Task Definitions: Admin must select at least one existing Form Definition (optionally multiple) when creating a Task Definition; task instances include all selected forms and end-users can fill and save each attached form individually within the task.
Implement backend support for Task Definitions that require at least one attached Form Definition and allow attaching multiple forms per Task Definition.

Implement backend APIs to create Task instances from a selected Task Definition and ensure new tasks inherit the definition’s attached forms and initialize per-form completion tracking as incomplete for each attached form.

Implement backend support for task-scoped form submissions so that each attached form can be filled and saved/submitted individually within a task, and completion status updates per form upon submission.

projectName: Low-code Task & Form Management (masters, dynamic forms, tasks, assignments, journey, SLA)
